website_summaries.verdict: This extremely popular package could be the right choice for you if you're looking for a guitar for a young beginner.
pros: A complete beginner's package at an extremely low price
Great for kids and pre-teens who are learning to play
cons: Quality issues with guitar construction and tone

customer_reviews.title: Bridge came apart when tuning it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing guitar for over 20 years, and have never had this happen before...I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter wanted a guitar but we were unsure how committed she would be to learning how to play. This is a nice package without a huge investment. We tuned it up and it sounds great. We got the black and it certainly looks and sounds like a much more expensive guitar. She flies here for the summers so the case was a nice addition for her to take it on the plane with her. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Catlady536

customer_reviews.title: Nice set for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Such a great kit for a beginner. Gives them everything they need to get started. The quality of the strings isn't great, but you can replace those pretty easily. The pitch pipe also isn't super impressive, but you really don't need it when you have the electric tuner (or you can just use an online tuner). The only complaint with this is that the strap was filthy when it arrived. Threw it in the washing machine and it was fine. Also, the strap is kind of small, so if it's a bigger kiddo or a grownup using it, you might have to get a different one. Overall though, this is a great inexpensive instrument to learn/practice on.
customer_reviews.author: Kay AyimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a deal?  This is not it - crap
customer_reviews.text: Crap-you get what you pay for...I was hoping for a "deal" because of some of the positive reviews thought I'd get lucky but the neck was cracked away from the body the fretboard was scratched and looks like parts were colored in with permanent marker, it was missing paint in spots just a crappy product. The only positive thing is it was well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice guitar for a kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little guitar for a kid. Probably more suitable for ages 6-12. The strings stretch alot at first so tuning is a constant BUT you have a guitar tuner included. I have it 4 stars because the case is really cheap and thin, won't take much to rip it. I also recommend getting a set of different picks. The one included is insanely huge but GREAT for little fingers just not adult ones lol the pitch pipe is awesome and works as a second toy for the kids to play with. All in all this is a great guitar for a child learning to play and for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Sorry unless the issue with the bridge is fixed I can't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this, but once I received it and tried to tune it based on electronic tuner provided with product. The bribe started to lift. I had to stop turning because I was afraid it would completely pull the bribe off. So I just bought a new and different guitar. Sorry unless the issue with the bridge is fixed I can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful guitar!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter, she has small hands and a regular size guitar was too big and cumbersome for her. This however, is the PERFECT size, and it's really beautiful. She is thrilled with it, and it sounds GREAT. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: urstandingonmytoes

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this item, not only is it cheaply made but it arrived with more than a dozen scratches and none of them were small
customer_reviews.text: This has to be a joke, the box came with absolutely zero tape on it and open on my front steps, as soon as I open the box you can see more than a dozen scratches all over the stem and box portion, this has to be a freaking joke This is nowhere close to a new product, I cannot believe that they can get away with stealing this, I will be returning this item before I even plucky a string
customer_reviews.author: Alex Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Value Guitar for Beginners but Beware of Modifications Needed for Full Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value guitar for a beginner. My older daughter purchased this for her little sister as a gift. Unfortunately, three of the strings didn't work so we had to go to Sam Ash Music to get them to fix the issue. It was explained to us that the guitar isn't very good quality and that it requires some modification in order to play above 8 Fret I believe it is called. I was told by Sam Ash that the cost to modify the guitar isn't worth doing so on this particular guitar. I'm a little disappointed but for the price it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Super Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Basically a toy..
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a bday gift for my 8yr old son. It's basically a toy guitar. Doesn't stay tuned, Horrible paint job, Dings, marks, scratches and bubbles all over it, no spot for the strap to be put on. I've gotten better guitars for my kids when they were 1 for $20 from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: My son wanted everything so instead I got him this ...
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted everything so instead I got him this guitar. He hasn't learned how to play anything except how to use the tuner which hasn't been tuned properly yet. Lol, it is small beginner guitar and it sounds more than adequate for his needs. Guitar vs Nike shoes... who won?
customer_reviews.author: Jack P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, but quickly outgrew
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas, because he expressed an interest in learning guitar. It was a great gift and has been played everyday since. It is a VERY beginner guitar though. I wish I would of just splurged and bought a more expensive one for him. With that said, I would recommend this for someone that is just interested in learning and not sure if it will be a passion or not (maybe kids...) The guitar has held up for 2 months now of several hours a day playing.
customer_reviews.author: JChilds

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good price for if somebody wants to just see if they like playing guitar, super cheap and comes with some good tools, however if you know you want to play guitar, spending the extra money for a better one is highly recommended, the guitar does a good job simulating a guitar but is super low quality (I know you get what you pay for) so overall I'm amazed with the low price but the craftsmanship is obviously cheap. Also a few scratches and paint chips came with it. (Check images)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Randall

customer_reviews.title: Beer money and a campfire
customer_reviews.text: Im having back surgery and needed something inexpensive to learn while im down. Instead of wasting $300, I figured for $40, worst case I'd hang it on the wall as "art" (I bought the blue one). Thinking that I've should of bought beer, I quickly learned that it wasn't exactly a childish toy. No, it isn't something that mick mars, Dave dudley, prince, or eric Clapton is gonna want to buy from you. However, if your unsure if you really want to learn and don't feel like reselling later, or your gifting to your destructive children or ever wanted to hit somebody with a guitar and not lose a bunch of money, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Fraticelli

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! The first few strings will not ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! The first few strings will not stay tuned no matter what I do. Was using an app that had both a tuner and chord practicer where you play on your guitar and after only a minute or two it stopped accepting it as it was so out of tune. Went back into the tuner section of it and retuned it every couple of minutes. The next issue is that the strap that came with it only had one mounting location and did not have the other. There was also the issue of there being rust on a few of the strings as well. As the icing on the cake the zipper to the bag came broken already.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Delmolino

customer_reviews.title: Quality... it aint!
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and color, but honestly, the quality is terrible. I am a new student and asked a friend to help tune it for the first time. He broke a string right off the bat because the strings are so cheap, and then couldn't get the tuner to work right so he used his own. Even after getting everything tuned the guitar would hold. The strings would loosen almost immediately. I'm very disappointed because I didn't want to spend a lot of money just for this one class. But I guess you do get what you pay for. I will have to order a better quality instrument.
customer_reviews.author: BenjiBoyz

customer_reviews.title: Best start up, affordable guitar out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely, by far, the best guitar there is for someone just starting and learning and is definitely the most affordable. The package came on time, no problems with delivery. Everything was intact and no scratches or damages. Definitely very impressed with this guitar and so surprised I got something way worth what I paid for. The only drawback I have Is that it does go out of tune after a while a little faster than more professional guitars but then again, this is just to start up and learn and once you've gotten the hand of it, you can pay for a more professional style but for now, to start, this is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas gift for my granddaughter who’s 9. It came today and I really liked it until I took it out of the box. It made a rattling noise, and I had to keep tilting it around until the miniature washer pictured below, fell out😒. But when I looked at the back, it has at least 20 scratches on it, also pictured below 👎. I’m not going through the hassle of returning it, it will still play. In the future, however, I’ll buy an item like this in person. 😠
customer_reviews.author: Jodi L. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Put nylon strings on this guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is a classical guitar. If you replace the steel strings with nylon it will sound good and hold up. This guitar is not the type that should have steel strings as there is no bracing or truss rod in the neck. They should not sell it with the strings it comes with. The issue with the bridge is to much tension from the steel strings. Plays nice and lasts with the proper strings though.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely buy this great quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my daughter and it works great, she plays it almost everyday and it sound like a professional guitar...I would 100% recommend this for anyone wanting to buy a guitar for a cheap price..but yeah this is very high quality and its real wood and there has been no paint chips at all what so ever and we've had it for a few months
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Have to keep re-tuning it needs a hard case
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic guitar for beginners, my girls bring it to school with them for music classes to learn. It comes with everything needed the downside is it has to be re-tuned near daily. The little auto tuner that comes with it makes that fairly easy but I think that is more due to being in a soft case than a hard case. The pins that tune each string get bumped as its transported causing it to go out of tune at least as far as I can tell that seems to be the issue so if you buy this, order a hard case for it too.
customer_reviews.author: william parker

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is junk! "Santa" got this for my daughter after looking at reviews thinking it would be fine for her since she is just starting out. Well we have had it for a year and she hasn't really done much with it but I finally signed her up for guitar lessons and this morning (the day before lessons start) she comes up crying and it's cracked. The most she has done with it is tune it (it won't hold a tune for long) and played it for a couple minutes. She is super careful with it too. It just wasn't constructed well. Don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: jamip

customer_reviews.title: Too poorly made to be safe
customer_reviews.text: I immediately returned this “guitar”. It was clear from the start this was poorly made( patchy paint, crooked frets) but the biggest concern was after I tuned it. The tension was pulling on the bridge a lot and I do not trust It to hold while my five year old strums away. Out of concern for injury to my child I returned it. Spend slightly more, get a fender sa150 or similar and it will last forever
customer_reviews.author: Alia

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. I guess you could say it's a good first guitar for kid who isn't really serious about playing the guitar but thinks they want one really bad. It doesn't stay in tune for very long after playing it. And the strings that come on it are not very strong I've broken at least three while tightening them... if you're serious about playing the guitar or learning and sticking with it then buy yourself a nice more expensive guitar.
customer_reviews.author: racerswife

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: My son had this guitar all of 4 days, we had tried to tune it , tightening the strings because they were barely attached when we received it, then as he strummed across the strings with his pick the bottom of the guitar separated, I don't care how tight these strings are, the bottom should not have separated like this. I have put in for a refund but of course you have to pay to ship it back, really nice!...I cannot and will not ever recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Laura L King

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 9 year old daughter. The item arrived as scheduled and well packaged. The overall quality of guitar was extremely poor. The action of the guitar was way too high and required significant filing on the nut to correct. The neck was slightly concave and has significant fret buzzing in multiple locations. This guitar will make it more challenging for an aspiring beginner and will likely lead to more frustration than its worth. Spend a bit more on a higher quality used guitar. Note= 10+ year musician with significant luthier skills.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dent

customer_reviews.title: Very terrible product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 1 star because when I received it, the string was broken and the package was already open. Later the tuner stopped working so I was unable to play the guitar at all. Then I decided to contact Amazon about this problem and they told me to call the manufacturer. I did this and they dismissed my problem and said that they couldn't locate my tracking number or order number. This guitar is not very good and you should not buy it. Customer service is atrocious and did not help me at all with any problems I had with this product. I do not suggest buying anything from this manufacturer or this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Shua-stia

customer_reviews.title: Total failure
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, the bridge pulled off the guitar so that I have used wood glue to reattach it, the wires come undone from the windings and these problems have made it impossible to keep in tune. I bought it for finger practice in between working with clients but so far all I've done is try to repair manufacturing problems. Really a waste of time and money. Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: johnie henderson

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the right sound
customer_reviews.text: Terrible issue with his guitar that we can't figure out what it is. We tune it with a tuner (3 different tuners), but the 6th string when pressed on the 5th spot is supposed to match the sound of the 5th string, but it doesn't. No matter how much we tune it, it just sounds off while playing. We can't figure it why. Are the breaks at the wrong location? Something is fundamentally wrong with this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: V's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this purchase! When I opened the package, the first thing I noticed was the huge dent & scratch on the bottom of the guitar. This is suppose to be a Christmas gift & since im unable to return it, im embarrassed that this is what a little girl will be opening. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: M.Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best guitar ever. There are some manufacturing flaws, such as the paint bring a bit irregular in spots. You can tell it's a mass produced item. However, this is a beginner level guitar for a person small in stature. And for that, I have no complaints - save one. The strings it came with were complete garbage. I immediately ordered a set of Ernie Ball acoustic strings, and the sound quality is much better. This was for son for Christmas, and he is also very happy with it. For a beginner guitar it's a fair price for a decent instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is and good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money but know what you’re getting. It’s definitely more of a toy than a more expensive guitar but it is good as a starter to see if your child would even be interested in playing. Strings are cheap and so is rest of guitar, but again for the money it is what is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight instrument; pitch pipe arrived defective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the guitar for myself to learn to play. I love color and the light weight of it. I also appreciate that it came with extra strings, pitch pipe and and auto tuner (with battery). The problem is that the "A" on the pitch pipe produces no sound. The battery cover on the auto tuner is very difficult to remove. Otherwise, I think this is a very nice instrument for a beginner guitarist.
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: Made great
customer_reviews.text: My husband decided he wanted to learn to play the guitar after listening to guns & Roses so he ordered this. Now he’s no Slash that’s for damn sure but it’s made good and when he does hit a good note sounds great. So we are stuck with somewhat good tunes around the campfire. Perfect for beginners!!! (get ear plugs if you suffer from hubby can’t play but you smile and be supportive of his new hobby during lockdown syndrome)
customer_reviews.author: jupiterco

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this product!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the product to buy for a beginner who really wants to learn the guitar. Apparently it has no truss rod and cannot be tuned. Complete waste of money! I bought this guitar for a Christmas present for my nephew, he noticed that it had a high pitch squel and weird vibration when he tried to play . Due to quarantine we were finally able to take it to a music shop today and they told us that he would never be able to tune or play because it is basically a for looks only guitar. My nephew is completely heartbroken!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: Truly unexpected gift for a friend's five-year-old birthday and the response was overwhelming. I opened it up to make sure nothing was damaged in shipping and saw that it was quite well packed and of good quality including all the accessories that came with it. This is a great price item very popular seller from what I could see, and I can see myself buying guitars for other children's as gifts in the future
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very inexpensive guitar but is still a good product. It came with a carrying bag, extra strings, a tuning "flute" and electronic tuner. The only problem was the electronic tuner it would not pick up sound no matter what we tried. We ended up downloading an app on our phones to tune the guitar then it all worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Larrissa

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else...
customer_reviews.text: Many manufacturing errors. No 2nd peg to hold the guitar strap (only the one on the bottom”. The tuner did not work. It powered on, but did nothing. 3 minutes later it stopped working completely. I couldn’t get it to turn on after that. The pick is more than double the size of a regular pick. I’m not sure - this may have been on purpose - but it is definitely odd.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Received it in good condition, was easy to tune and sounds superb! Came with all the accessories. The strap is easy to attach and has the string that you loop through the top hole on the strap, then under the strings behind the nut (first fret). I’m having fun with this guitar, and it’s a really cute black! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: R. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Garbage...don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back. I’ve been playing guitar for over 30 yrs and I wanted something for my 5 year old to use and possibly start to learn on. The only thing good about this purchase was the tuner. The frets overlapped the neck and were sharp. The guitar could not be tuned to standard or Eb tuning because the bridge was starting to pull up from the guitar and the tuners couldn’t even hold the tension of the strings.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound! Good price! Worth every penny to watch my Son play gospel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 year old son! He loves playing gospel music with PawPaw! It’s been such a blessing to have this and to watch him play with it. It actually sounds really good too and comes with lots of extras. The larger guitar picks was nice to have & better for my son. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda McCarrell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and poor care
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. The guitar strap holder wasn’t screwed on so you can’t even use the strap. The strings were very lazily out on. I have never string a guitar but had to restring because how loose they were. They need to put more care into what they are doing. Only thing is the blue color is nice. Wow not much.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You definitely get what you pay for. Doesn’t stay in tune for more than 5 minutes. Size is good, which was the sole purpose for purchasing. Action (distance between strings and neck), is rather high which makes it difficult for little fingers to hold chords. If you are on a budget and the intent is to get your kid started, it will work, but if you can afford a better one, then get a better one. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: This is real guitar not a toys
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 9 year old son he love it. You can’t buy real guitar for 40 dollar. But this guitar is real and works just like a expensive one. Also it will come several extra stuffs which costs more than 40 dollar. If you are bigger please buy it it worth
customer_reviews.author: binod

customer_reviews.title: it does not hold the tuning
customer_reviews.text: understood we get what we paid for, $45 guitar where the cheapest good quality decent guitar costs around $150, so if you want to buy a guitar for your kid and dont care about how it sounds much and not bother about hitting it against the floor or the wall, then is fine just play with it. However, what is very dissapointed is that the guitar does not hold the tune, i have to tune all the time and that it is not acceptable... i am thinking to return it asap
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Missing some items
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t even arrive with what was listed in the description. I received the guitar and the case. There was supposed to be a tuner, guitar pick, a strap, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, decent guitar
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and 8n good condition, although the shipping box got damaged. The tuner does not work and the strings were strung poorly. The guitar is just a pictures otherwise, and the case slides down over the top from the arm to the base. We did order a guitar from this company in the past and that guitar had a small crack. Overall though they are very nice guitars and good quality for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar for kids or the elderly
customer_reviews.text: Great little guitar set for a kid !! I use it with senior citizens in the nursing home and will probably buy two more for other folks. It sounds decent and feels sturdy. This is not a concert instrument and nice way to start or just to have a guitar to play with for a child, disabled adult or the elderly!!
customer_reviews.author: Wild Serene H Force

customer_reviews.title: OK-ish starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar because I wasn't sure if I was really going to use it. I figured I'd get something cheap to mess around with and could upgrade later if I found I wanted to stick with playing. Recently I started using it more, and I've found that the lower on the neck I go to hit some higher notes, the strings are flat because the frets aren't leveled very well and the strings touch the frets below the note I'm trying to hit. Also, the nut looks pretty loose and will probably detach at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Spretty

customer_reviews.title: Not even a Pro could make music on this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar so my 7 year old daughter could try to learn to play. My father, who’s been playing for years, told me that the guitar is warped and the strings are way too far from the frets for even an experienced guitarist. He couldn’t even play it. Also, the second knob that the strap is supposed to attach to was missing, so my daughter couldn’t really hold the guitar correctly if she wanted to. Lastly, it would not stay tuned. I tried and tried, but only one string would stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to learn how to play and this really helped me. I didn't want to make a big investment in an expensive guitar if I was not really going to commit to learn. Hence, this guitar is pretty solid for me. It's very light weight and is probably a 3/4 sized guitar. The only con is that frets don't have the dots in then so it's harder to count.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: This is a toy or a stage prop, not an instrument.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to convince your child that playing guitar is a horrible and unrewarding experience, buy them one of these guitars. If you want your child to love music and playing guitar, buy them a real 3/4 sized guitar from a different manufacturer. (Tips: make sure the guitar that you buy has a real bridge with a real saddle and a truss rod, and heed the 1 and 2 star reviews. I didn't, and the positive reviews I read had nothing to do with the reality of this toy/prop.)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Shults

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service product is fine.
customer_reviews.text: The product is what you would expect for that price so I'm more less happy with that. I am very satisfied with this Seller. They responded to questions or concerns timely and ultimately went beyond what was needed to make me feel like they were invested in good customer service. I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This was not a bad product by any means. Why I only gave it 4 stars for value is because you might be able to go to a music store and possibly buy a better guitar (albeit a used one) but likely hear it play and maybe get them to throw in a free first lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Nice Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was pretty quick ordered it the 10th & got it the 16th, so not to long of a wait. Upon receiving I opened it up to inspect. Seems to be in good shape. Included everything in pictures. Ordered it for my son's Christmas present so won't know till then on how it plays & what not. Bit so far I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Nena

customer_reviews.title: This Guitar Is Great for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: This guitar was bought for my grandson to learn to play. It is well suited for someone who does not wish to invest a lot of money for what could be a passing interest. I bought it to be simply a beginner instrument with plans to replace it if he continues to show interest. It is a great instrument for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyL

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The cost Looks cool Nice paint job Good starter guitar for learning or practice Cons: g string snapped while tuning Not the best sound Cheaply constructed If you want to get a guitar for practice, learning, messing around with, this guitar is perfect for you. If you collect guitars, and play them frequently, you will want to sell it after using it for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Aguiar

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I expected at all, a plastic one would have been better made. Will NOT hold tuning! I recommend the Fender or the Yamaha, cost more but truth is you do get what you pay for. YOU MUST PAY POSTAGE TO RETURN THIS JUNK MADE THING, DON'T WASTE YOUR $CASH$!!!
customer_reviews.author: Docdreaded

customer_reviews.title: Great as a starter guiter
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a guitar to learn on then this is it, You will have to download a guitar tuning app on your phone and tune it as it does not come tuned and not even close to being able to be played out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Terrible Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Writing this as someone who had never before picked up a guitar. The unit is solid and comes with a bunch of fun extras. Once I got it tuned, which took me a while to figure out, I had lots of fun playing along with how to videos on YouTube. For the price it's a great investment. If I become proficient I may upgrade, but at <$50 for a new hobby, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Okay...
customer_reviews.text: Good for a starter guitar. The strings are way to far from the actual guitar. So my 11yr old can’t use it. Which sucks because no we have to buy another guitar that will work. I think for a grown up this would work (I have small hands so for me it doesn’t work).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Howard

customer_reviews.title: It's actually crap unless..
customer_reviews.text: So, the strings sit incredibly high from the neck and there is no way to adjust this, making it extremely difficult to play. Would HIGHLY suggest to avoid this guitar UNLESS A. It's a gift for someone you secretly hate! B. You want to feel bad about yourself.. C. It's time to mislead your tinder date even more than you already have! Seriously, AVOID, I got fooled by the high rating. Crap return policy too, FYI
customer_reviews.author: Joel Elwell

customer_reviews.title: Needs work to be playable.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a beginner guitar, but this would make learning difficult. The major issues are with the neck, which has no markings (the dots at 3,5,7,9 & 12). It has no radius, and the nut is entirely too tall. The tuners are cheap, but that was expected. The bridge is plastic and questionable as it is riveted to the body.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: A beginner guitar but only that.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first guitar ever and I carried it around campus as I learned. It is not durable at all and feels cheap in the hands but for the price it is still worth it to learn. It came with steel strings which I recommend replacing as soon as possible as this is a classical guitar and should be strung with nylon. I have no regrets with the purchase although I have moved on to better guitars, this one has a special place in my heart.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Fleece

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is you get what you pay for. I recommend spending more money on a better quality guitar. I bought this, and was a POS
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Useless even for a total beginner
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I assume because I did not cough up the extra insurance fee, I was shipped an item that was superficially whole but functionally faulty. Between the second and fourth frets on the first and second string the notes are totally indistinct such that it is impossible to play a chromatic scale. Useless even for a total beginner
customer_reviews.author: Mani

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the road
customer_reviews.text: don’t know why this review will not allow me to submit my choices. 1) 4stars- definitely for beginner 2) craftsmanship-3stars, built well but there are lots of bubbles in the paint. I can see it will be chipping 3) 4stars because it’s not cheap but not expensive. I would give it a 5, but the paint is bubbled and the strings are difficult to replace
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Strings break easily, Surface was scratched
customer_reviews.text: I am currently learning how to play guitar, so this was my first one that I actually bought to practice on. After learning how to tune a guitar, I attempted to do so using the digital tuner that came in the set. The E and A strings tuned great, however the D string completely snapped before I could finish tuning it. After then learning how to restring a guitar, I tried tuning it with the backup D string. Again, it snapped. The guitar itself is very basic, which is perfect for a beginner like myself. The sound is nice and deep. The only fault I have is with the D string breaking, and the knobs not staying in place.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Quality is exceptional and the price is a steal!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a steal of a purchase! My 11yo was very interested in learning the guitar but on a single mom budget, I didn’t have a lot of spend! He started private lessons and even the teacher was impressed with the quality! It’s just the right size and he’s thriving on the knowledge! I’m so impressed with the product and all that came with it for such an affordable price! Thank you for helping me give him a gift that will last a lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: She loved it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter who said she wanted to learn how to play guitar. I think this is great for a child who wants to figure out whether or not they want to play. There was no damage to the guitar it sounds/plays well. Everyone thought it was a great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Frets are incorrectly spaced.
customer_reviews.text: Besides the quality being beyond terrible - as expected from price - it would at least be worth the buy if otherwise it performed the way it should. But, turns out the frets are incorrectly spaced - tuning each string with a tuner and tuning with the 5th-fret method cause the notes to be off. 5th-fret method produces VERY sharp notes. Chords sound wrong and all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Scratched
customer_reviews.text: The guitar is great for the price and works as it should but it came with a big scratch in the paint. It was a Christmas gift for a relative so it was not really an option to return for me. It had to be scratched when they sent it because the packaging was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Skip
customer_reviews.text: Spend a little more money and get a better crafted guitar. MHz of nylon and metal strings. Doesn’t stay in tune long. Looks sharp but get something better, even for a beginner. They will be frustrated just trying to keep in tune.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Magarelli

customer_reviews.title: Mmeeehhhhhh
customer_reviews.text: Eh. Meh. You definitely get what you pay for. I mean, it's alright and it serves its purpose but you can definitely tell it's not a "legit" guitar. Tuning it didnt really make it any better. I ended up returning the product and got a better guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Bevvy

customer_reviews.title: It's good but when I received it
customer_reviews.text: It's good but when I received it. It had a smudge on it and also for the strap and only has one strap holder it's missing another one in order to attach the strap so another words I cannot attach the strap at all other than that place good everything was in it
customer_reviews.author: rodolfo estrada

customer_reviews.title: Good fora kid
customer_reviews.text: Good starter guitar. Got it for my middle schooler who has a guitar class. It is a bit hard to get in tune but comes with the electronic tuner that makes it easier. Not amazing, but just what we needed at the right price point. Comes with a fabric bag that has backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic beginners guitar. I bought it for my 10 year old and it’s perfect. I don’t know much about guitars but this seems really great, especially for the price. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Just Dance Now

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but decent
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad buy for the price. I'm not musically inclined so I cannot give an accurate review on tone. It however serves its purpose for my 10yo who is taking music lessons. The feel is not as durable as the Yamaha he previously outgrew but so far no faults to craftsmanship
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: its ok for a 5 year old to beat on.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something basic for my kid to play with and the guitar isnt bad, its just the strings are way to far from the fretboard. even an adult cant really hold a chord for more than a second or 2. the kid likes it so i guess it will do for now
customer_reviews.author: Chris B. Hirner

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner set
customer_reviews.text: This is great for beginners and folks who haven't touched a guitar in a long time. I especially like the nylon strings which help as you build up that calloused layer on your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: Strings are bad
customer_reviews.text: I would say this guitar is great for beginners but what if your a beginner who doesn't know how to change guitar strings? The guitar body is okay but the strings that come on it need to be replaced and the extras they give you are just as bad as the ones on it. So you have to buy brand new strings.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality even for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: It came all chipped and very low quality, very low quality materials used to make this guitar, its even got dents in it all over the base, also feels like cheap wood like a type of plastic. We noticed these defects too late to return the guitar, since it was a gift bought months in advance.
customer_reviews.author: LaJincha

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of this. they come with the bag, and 2 tuning tools. but the guitar itself is really awfully made. the arm is bended , distorted so there is no way to really adjust the cords Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Quesada

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect set up for a beginner guitarist! Absolute value! Durability is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty much a toy.
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit disappointed. Very difficult to tune. Did not come with nylon strings. When trying to tune it, one of the strings snapped.Had to bring it the guitar center, to get strung correctly, for 30 more dollars. It’s fun to play with, but it’s a toy really. Not a certified instrument. I feel like I should have gone for the real mccoy RIP OFF...
customer_reviews.author: Susan Roth

customer_reviews.title: Guitar is OK, but doesn't keep a tune, bag is terrible don't use it.
customer_reviews.text: The guitar itself is ok for a beginner, but it cannot keep a tune, which means it is in need of constant adjustment. For beginners because they get a lot of practice tuning their guitar, but that quickly becomes very tedious. I would give the product a 3 star for that, but what dropped it down to a 2 is the gigbag that comes with it. The first time it was worn the straps ripped clean off of it and the guitar tumbled to the ground getting damaged. This product is cheap enough to see if a young person has the discipline to practice and learn, but if they show interest you will have to replace this guitar quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Guitar is a bit lighter than I originally expected but it's great for beginners and, to my very untrained ears, seems to be a great sound. Wish there were a bit of directions as to where to put the tuner on the guitar and how to attach the strap, still haven't figured that part out, but those are just small critiques
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Bridge Pulled Out - Installed Wrong
customer_reviews.text: While attempting to tune the guitar, the mounting hardware (nuts) attaching the bridge to the body of the guitar pulled through the front. The bridge was held in place with 2 small screws and nuts and a dab of glue. The screws should have penetrated the face of the guitar AND a small block of wood attached to the backside of the guitar face. The screws were installed approx. 1/4" inch above the small block of wood. Had the screws and bridge been installed in the correct location, the nuts would not have pulled through the face of the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This guitar was so horribly made and defective
customer_reviews.text: This guitar was so horribly made and defective. Attempted to return the product and the seller stated that return is at the customer's expense.. This was a cheap buy that I REGRET. It would cost $50 to ship back - which is more than this is worth. If you are looking for a beginner guitar - do NOT purchase this. Go to guitar center. They have reasonable prices and VERY well made products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was on a budget but my husband has been wanting to learn how to play & I thought I’d buy him a beginners guitar and I’m just going to say you get what you get for that price
customer_reviews.author: Diana Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Chipped paint, but good value.
customer_reviews.text: The guitar arrived in okay condition. There are a few chips in the paint under the strings. The guitar is also cheaply made, but it was also a very inexpensive guitar. I was not expecting super high quality. The quality matches the price. I am frustrated that the guitar did not come with the case like it said it would. I would rate it 4 stars if it came with the case.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Good practice guitar
customer_reviews.text: The guitar has a rich sound but have to tune every other day.. Put new strings on it and still the same. But for the 35.00 I can't complain. Good practice guitar.. Recommend using lite gauge strings.. It a laminated machine produced guitar. .This is a different brand, but I have three all made the same..
customer_reviews.author: Paddleballmag

customer_reviews.title: Broke after tuning it.
customer_reviews.text: It broke just after I tuned it up. The string bridge is not glued down properly. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Hann

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and good way to learn
customer_reviews.text: It's not made for abuse, it'll work for gentle use, change the strings first off the ones that come with it are cheap amd don't last. It's very lightweight, but to teach kids responsibility and a cheap way to see if they'll stick with it, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Thornton

customer_reviews.title: I'm deployed to the Middle East and I bought this ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm deployed to the Middle East and I bought this guitar in hopes to learn on my down time. After getting it I quickly realized that the frets were messed up in multiple locations. Making it to where you can't play any chords because the strings buzz when depressed. I emailed them a few times trying to work something out and they stopped responding after I gave them my order number. I would spend a little extra money and get one that's gonna work right and who's customer service actually does their job. Now I'm stuck with this worthless guitar and it costs as much as it's worth to ship it so returning it is almost not even worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan beall

customer_reviews.title: POORLY MADE!! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been playing guitar for 5 years and this is the first time this has happened. The bridge snapped while tightening, on the first day i got it. LITERALLY THE FIRST DAY. I didn’t even get to enjoy it before it snapped. Don’t know if it was defective but this was definitely not worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Altamirano

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for starters
customer_reviews.text: it was a gift but the person it was for LOVES it and I've been thanks many times.
customer_reviews.author: Delicia Gurisko

customer_reviews.title: this is a good idea for very beginners who aren't sure if they'll ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a good idea for very beginners who aren't sure if they'll stick with the Guitar or not. If you don't, you haven't wasted too much money. If you do, this is an easy to use and tune guitar which will get you through your first year or so of lessons.
customer_reviews.author: SoBayCPA

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was minimal - amazed it wasn't damaged
customer_reviews.text: As a Xmas gift I should have been given the option for it to be sent inside another box to hide the contents. Packaging was minimal - amazed it wasn't damaged. I can't say how it works as a guitar since it's a gift but it is supposed to be solid black. There is a long white triangle down the back that looks like a flaw in the material.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to see if I could learn to play. I opened the box, and started tuning the guitar right away and in 20 minutes I had it tuned and learned I can play due to physical limitations. But Its a great sounding guitar and even looks fabulous. Great price and great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Challender

product_meta.title: Best Choice Products 38in Beginner Acoustic Guitar Starter Kit w/Case, Strap, Digital E-Tuner, Pick, Pitch Pipe, Strings (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

Jam out in style with an acoustic guitar set that's perfect for aspiring musicians. With an all-wood body, synthetic wood fretboard, steel strings, and a classical guitar shape, it produces a bright sound with every strum. The set comes with everything you need, including a pick, digital tuner, pitch pipe, shoulder strap, an extra set of strings, and even a nylon case to take it on the go! 

Specifications: 
Overall Dimensions: 38"(L) x 3.25"(W) x 14"(H) 
Weight: 4.7 lbs. 
Neck Material: Sapele Wood 
Fretboard Material: Synthetic Wood 
Case Material: Nylon 
Intended for right-handed use 
No assembly required 

Package Includes: 
Guitar 
Case 
Pitch pipe 
Guitar pick 
Shoulder strap 
Digital tuner 
Replacement strings
feature_bullets: 38-INCH ACOUSTIC GUITAR: Right-handed guitar delivers a full-bodied sound with its all-wood design, 19 frets, steel strings, and an attractive finish
ULTIMATE STARTER KIT: Perfect for beginner guitarists, it includes a guitar pick, shoulder strap, pitch pipe, digital tuner, and an extra set of 6 strings
HIGH-QUALITY SOUND: The classical guitar body and user-friendly fretboard help to create a bright sound that both beginning and experienced musicians can enjoy
CARRYING CASE INCLUDED: Take your show on the road, as this guitar comes with a nylon carrying case that allows for easy storage and portability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars8,063 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
